name: spikily
content:
spikily adverb
(POINTED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is covered with spikes (= thin, narrow shapes with sharp points at one end), or has that appearance: Even their hairstyles are spikily similar. The movement is precise, and spikily danced.
More examplesFewer examplesThe balconies are rectangular along one side of the building, and spikily triangular on another.The hills stood up spikily against the night sky.Her coarse hair stood up spikily.

spikily adverb
(BAD MOOD)
informal in a way that is not polite and that shows that you are annoyed: When this criticism was put to him, he reacted spikily. Even his close colleagues spoke of him in a spikily dismissive way.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter three defeats already against the other team, they responded spikily to them.She sits spikily in judgment on her poor friends.They were spikily competitive for a long time, but were eventually defeated.
